sub_title: ECOM & BH Merchandiser at Under Armour | Sales |  Customer Service | E-Commerce | Product Development |  Procurement | Operations
summary:
As an EMEA DTC Men's Merchandiser at Under Armour, I apply my skills and passion in sales, e-commerce, data analytics, procurement, innovation, and sustainability to deliver the perfect assortments following the seasonal strategy to our customers. I have extensive experience in the fashion and apparel industry, having worked for renowned brands such as Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger as a sales and merchandising coordinator, and completing four internships in product development, buying, and research. 

I graduated with a bachelor's degree in Fashion and Textile Technologies from Saxion University of Applied Sciences in 2020, where I maintained a scholarship throughout my studies and earned a certificate in Management of Fashion and Luxury Companies from Università Bocconi. I have a strong interest in sustainable production, and I have contributed to research projects on smart functional materials and textile recycling. My goal is to pursue a career in the lifestyle, fashion, apparel, FMCG, or chemical industries, where I can leverage my multi-cultural background, enthusiasm, and creativity to make a positive impact.

awards.title: Saxion Excellent Scholarship
awards.description:
Saxion Excellent Scholarship (SES) is a scholarship for Saxion students who have passed exceptionally well during their study year of their bachelor programme and would like to continue studying the same programme in the next study year at Saxion UAS.
The required ECTS’s are 54 Credits out of 60 and must have been gained during your last academic year (between 1 September of last year and 31 Augustus of current year).

awards.title: Extended Saxion Talent Scholarship
awards.description:
A student is required to have gained at least 54 ECTS in the previous academic year in
order to be granted an ESTS for the next academic year. The norm of the ECTS for one
regular academic year is 60 ECTS. A student who enrolled in September 2017 must have
gained at least 54 ECTS and a student who enrolled in February 2018 must have gained at
least 27 ECTS.

awards.title: Saxion Excellent Scholarship
awards.description:
Saxion Excellent Scholarship (SES) is a scholarship for Saxion students who have passed the first year of their bachelor programme and would like to continue studying the same programme in the next study year (2nd, 3rd or 4th year) at Saxion UAS.
The required ECTS’s are 54 Credits out of 60 and must have been gained during your last academic year (between 1 September of last year and 31 Augustus of current year).

awards.title: Saxion Talent Scholarship
awards.description: This scholarship is meant for talented students with above average study results who apply for a bachelor programme. The scholarship only applies to non-EU/EEA students who pay full institutional tuition fee.

projects.title: Potential Eco Labels for Jomo Fashion
projects.description: Explored the potential Eco-labels for Jomo Fashion, researched on eco-labels and sustainable initiatives that would match their budget, customer preferences and company vision. This project was conducted for my final bachelor thesis.

contributors.headline: ECOM & BH Merchandiser at Under Armour | Sales |  Customer Service | E-Commerce | Product Development |  Procurement | Operations

projects.title: The glueing and welding of woven textiles by using adhesive
projects.description: By using the chromojet machine adhesive was applied from Tanatex on woven cotton fabric and then fixated by using the heat press machine or ultra sound welding machine. The strength of the fixated samples were later tested using the tensile strength machine. Different adhesives were tested, the different chromojet machine parameters were experimented with and the fixating settings were adjusted in order to obtain the best results.

courses.name: Advanced Certificate in Textiles and Apparels

profile_positions.description:
•Assorting styles across 5 new O&O stores in the UK and the Netherlands which grew Mens business by 14% YoY 
• In-Season changes and Implementations done in ECOM grew men's business by 35% YoY 
• Creating assortments for the ECOM and retail channels
• Managing inventory of stores and warehouses by collaborating with allocations and Logistics
• Coaching retail staff on products, collections, and seasonal strategy
• Improving sales by providing detailed analysis of ECOM and Retail performance to cross-functional teams on a weekly basis with action points
• Collaborating with Planning to forecast on Pre-Season Buy using seasonal strategy, targets, and sales data
• Improving logistical and operational processes
profile_positions.title: EMEA DTC Men's Merchandiser

profile_positions.description:
•Setting up and managing 300 to 500 styles and options in PLM per season
• Creating the color card and collection outline on PLM
• Creating a weekly sell out report for CKJ and CK SPW Accessories
• Effective note taking for updating PLM accurately
• Creating pricing and fashionability proposals
• Managing the deliveries of receiving and outgoing samples
• Worked on competitor price benchmarking research
• Created Sales Tools such as Collection Manual, Sustainability Deck andVisual Sales Memo
profile_positions.title: Merchandising Coordinator - Footwear & Accessories

profile_positions.description:
• Administered 3 seasons of orders into an ERP system (WeConnect)
• Analyzed KPIs to support divisions in making key decisions 
• Produced an Order Process Manual for the Sales team
• Created Post Season Sell-in Analysis for several divisions
• Effectively using SAP to create stock proposals
• Created Never Out of Stock best seller packages for Non-Key customers
profile_positions.title: Sales Coordinator - Calvin Klein & Tommy Hilfiger Kids MEA+

profile_positions.description:
• Demonstrated analytical thinking and problem- solving skills necessary to troubleshoot production issues.
• Address problems with production equipment and machinery and fix them as needed.
• Assemble goods on production lines.
• Multi-task in a fast-paced production environment.
• Adhered to all safety guidelines dictation the production and handling of materials in the factory.
• Inspected assembled products to ensure they are up to quality standards.
• Identified problems or malfunctions with machinery and equipment.
• Reported issues or problems with production to immediate supervisor.
• Exhibited the ability to work cautiously but efficiently in potentially hazardous conditions.
profile_positions.title: Productiemedewerker- (Uitzendbureau 4 Minutes)

profile_positions.description:
• Data management in the PISA system
• Supported buyers with administrative tasks
• Sample management
• Order entry and following up with suppliers
• Worked closely with merchandisers to ensure on-time delivery of products
profile_positions.title: Buying Intern

profile_positions.description:
Project - Digitally Patterned Welding of Woven Cotton Textiles
Collaboration Company - Tanatex
• Tested out the glueing strength of different adhesives given by
Tanatex
• Expanded knowledge on, conducting the tensile test, washing
test, fixating with the heat press machine and ultrasound
welding machine .
• Gained knowledge on using the Chromojet machine. The
different parameters, designs and limitations.
• Made in depth analysis and comparisons between the results
(from the different adhesives, their tensile strength and their
fixating parameters).
• Tested an original hypothesis regarding the thickener effect on
the adhesive strength which turned out to be a success.
• Participated in internal Smart Functional Materials meetings and
meetings with Tanatex executives discussing progress.
profile_positions.title: Research & Development Intern at Research Group Smart Functional Materials

profile_positions.description:
• Worked with bulk and development merchandising teams and
gained exposure on style and reference files, material GRN
process, preparation of sample tags and PLM color mapping.
• Expanded knowledge on lean practices, garment technology,
design process, supply chain management, sampling process,
costing, commercial and finance.
• Gained knowledge on material qualities, wash and fabric
inspection process.
• Gained fundamental exposure and training on how to effectively
use the ERP system (SAP).
• Visited a few plants to understand the process.
• Participated in customer meetings.
• Contributed to order management processes
• Supported merchandisers with inseason analysis to aid strategic desicions
profile_positions.title: Development Merchandising Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Carried out thorough research on “New industries Noyon Lanka
can target”.
• Organized fabric directory
• Represented Noyon Lanka as a member of the design team for
the Mercedes Benz Fashion Week.
• Supported day-to-day program specific tasks (Digital Mood
boards & Swatch Cards).
• Composed a research report on the new performance wear
products which can be created from the current knitting
machines at Noyon Lanka based on customer requirements.
